overall_summary: The reasoning process focused on forecasting 96 future hourly values using time-series analysis with strong emphasis on daily seasonality detection. Initial considerations included advanced statistical methods like SARIMA and Exponential Smoothing, but the final approach adopted a heuristic method of hourly averaging due to limited data size (4 days) and implementation constraints. The solution prioritized capturing daily patterns while acknowledging potential data limitations.
key_insights: Daily seasonality identification through 24-hour pattern analysis
Data size limitations (96 points) favoring simple methods over complex models
Use of hourly averaging to maintain pattern consistency while reducing noise
Explicit consideration of missing value handling despite clean input data
Rejection of weekly seasonality due to insufficient historical data
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with initial statistical model exploration, ultimately simplifying to heuristic methods. Combined time-series fundamentals (seasonality detection, stationarity considerations) with practical implementation constraints for deliverable generation.
